tegmen: <entryFree id="n47639" type="main" key="tegmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tegmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. tegimen.</entryFree>
tego: <entryFree id="n47640" type="main" key="te^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ste/gw,</foreign> to cover; <foreign lang="greek">te/gos, ste/gos,</foreign> roof; Sanscr. sthag-, to hide; Germ. decken; Engl thatch</etym>, <sense id="n47640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> (syn. operio). </sense><sense id="n47640.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47640.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amica corpus ejus (Alcibiadis) texit suo pallio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 2, 69, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite se totum tegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tegillo) tectus esse soleo, si pluvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: fere res omnes aut corio sunt Aut etiam conchis <pb n="1846" /> <cb n="TEGO" /> aut callo aut cortice tectae, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 936</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae aliae coriis tectae sunt, aliae villis vestitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tecti, ut vestiti, ut salvi esse possemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 69, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora veste villosā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars tunicā adamantinā tectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis Vaginā tectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. —In Greek constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">primā tectus lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucullo caput tectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:14:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (casae) more Gallorum stramentis erant tectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectas casas testudinum superficie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 24, 28, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: naves tectae, <hi rend="ital">covered with decks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decked</hi> ( = constratae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 13</bibl> (opp. apertae); <cit><quote lang="la">31, 46, 6: tectae instrataeque scaphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepto tegeret cum lumina somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utne tegam spurco Damae latus?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to go by the side of</tr>, <tr>walk cheek by jowl with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">latus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis eum stipata tegebat Turba ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 26</bibl>: sarta tecta; v. sartus. — </sense><sense id="n47640.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47640.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (rare in lit. sense; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: abscondo, occulto): Caesar tectis insignibus suorum occultatisque signis militaribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientem silvae texerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves (silva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (tabellas) tegat in tepido sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae latibulis se tegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nebula matutina texerat inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem nebulae possiderent ac tegerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> prol. 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47640.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi> (rare in lit. sense); constr., in analogy with defendere and tueri, <hi rend="ital">aliquid ab aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui portus ab Africo tegebatur, ab Austro non erat tutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alter (ordo propugnatorum) ponte ab incidentibus telis tegeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conservare et tegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 1:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas et nostros texit et naves Rhodias afflixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumpho, si licet me latere tecto abscedere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a whole skin</tr>, <tr>safe</tr>, <tr>unhurt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">tegi magis Romani quam pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47640.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">te modo terra tegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 44</bibl></cit> (3, 22, 24): <cit><quote lang="la">sit tibi terra levis mollique tegaris harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:29:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa tegebat humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa tegit tumulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicanio tegitur sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 548</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47640.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47640.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas, mihi quae modestiam omnem, Detexit tectus quā fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47640.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47640.10" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep secret</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi nomine tegere atque velare cupiditatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis simulationum involucris tegitur et quasi velis quibusdam obtenditur unius cujusque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignaviam suam tenebrarum ac parietum custodiis tegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ejus vultu, flagitia parietibus tegebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam prudentiam simulatione stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestā praescriptione rem turpissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turpia facta oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mendacio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tyranni humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non uti corporis vulnera, ita exercitus incommoda sunt tegenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostram sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoribus dabas multa tegenda meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: ignobilitatis tegendae causā, Cap. Max. 8. — </sense><sense id="n47640.11" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid excusatione amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod is meam salutem atque vitam suā benevolentiā, praesidio custodiāque texisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri clarissimorum hominum auctoritate leges et jura tecta esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula facile innocentiā tecti repellemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a patrum crudelibus suppliciis tegere liberos sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tegere ac tueri, Cic Fam. 13, 66, 2: libertatem, patriam, parentisque armis tegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: ut legatos cura magistratuum magis quam jus gentium ab irā impetuque hominum tegeret, <cb n="TELA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationisque jure satis tectum se arbitraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tec-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47640.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47640.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not frank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">plain; secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguised; close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo verbis tectus,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>, <tr>enveloped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verba (opp. apertissima),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultior atque tectior cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 619</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of persons: occultus et tectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecti esse ad alienos possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in dicendo mihi videri tectissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silet ille, tectusque recusat Prodere quemquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 126</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis consideratior illo? Quis tectior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 16</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tectō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">covertly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen ab illo aperte, tecte quicquid est datum, libenter accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tegulae: <entryFree id="n47641" type="main" key="te_gu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēgŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (less freq. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, also in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tēgŭla</orth>, ae; <sense id="n47641.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <hi rend="ital">tiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roof-tiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tiled roof</hi> (class.; cf. imbrex). </sense><sense id="n47641.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas venit, confringit tegulas imbricesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with imbrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, quid agis tu inquam in tegulis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in tegulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; 2, 2, 5; 2, 3, 13; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 37: anguis per impluvium decidit de tegulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per alienas tegulas Venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tegulas demitti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demptis tegulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per scalas pervenisse in tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare sub tegulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbaria qui in tegulis habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24" default="NO">39, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">TEGVLAS AENEAS AVRATAS D. S. D.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3272</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n47641.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promitto tibi, si valebit, tegulam illum in Italiā nullam relicturum,</quote> <trans><tr>not a tile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solem nondum prohibebat et imbrem Tegula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 622</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 304</bibl>; Bibacul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:36:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:201" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 201</bibl> (but the true read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 5</bibl>, is regula, Haase).</sense></entryFree>
tegulicius: <entryFree id="n47642" type="gloss" key="te_gu^li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēgŭlĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tegulae</etym>, <sense id="n47642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with tiles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ATTEGIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1396</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tegulum: <entryFree id="n47643" type="main" key="te^gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n47643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thatch</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tegulo aquaticarum harundinum domos suas operiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scirpi fragiles ad tegulum tegetesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 70, § 178</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tegumen: <entryFree id="n47644" type="main" key="te^gu^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕgŭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. tegimen.</entryFree>
tegumentum: <entryFree id="n47645" type="main" key="te^gu^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕgŭmentum</orth> (collat. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕgĭ-mentum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tegmentum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n47645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47645.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tegmen): tegumenta corporum vel texta vel suta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tegumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40, 3</bibl>; 22, 1, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 90, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutisque tegimenta detrudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tegimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 63: palpebrae quae sunt tegmenta oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>armor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 4, 6</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n47645.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec mihi ego semper habui aetati tegumentum meae, Ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a defence</tr>, <tr>protection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit> dub. (Ritschl and Fleck. integumentum).</sense></entryFree>
teius: <entryFree id="n47646" type="main" key="Te_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Teos.</entryFree>
tela: <entryFree id="n47647" type="main" key="te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. contr. from texia, from texo; cf. ala, from axilla; <cit><quote lang="la">mala, from maxilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n47647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a web.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47647.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">texentem telam studiose ipsam offendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelope telam retexens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui telas discreverat auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus in telā deducitur argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commenta retexere tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:22" default="NO">34, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanā et telā victum quaeritans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduis exercet bracchia telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:699" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquas exercet telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena domus telarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">spider</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s web</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deiciamque eorum (araneorum) omnis telas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47647.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47647.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The threads that run lengthwise in the loom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the warp</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">stamen, trama),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:79" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 79</bibl></cit>: licia telae Addere, <cb n="TELE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 275</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 54</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n47647.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A weaver</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yarn-beam;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a loom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 576</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47647.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a web</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorsa haec tela non male omnino mihi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad detexundam telam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ea tela texitur et ea incitatur in civitate ratio vivendi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
telamo: <entryFree id="n47648" type="greek" key="te^la^mo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlămo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlămon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">telamw/n</foreign> (a bearer, supporter); in architecture, <sense id="n47648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male figure that supports an entablature;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">telamones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47649" type="main" key="Te^la^mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlămo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlămon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*telamw/n,</foreign> <sense id="n47649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Argonaut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Æacus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Peleus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Ajax and Teucer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:89" default="NO">89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:97" default="NO">97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:354" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:476 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 476 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 216</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 58</bibl>; 3, 29, 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax Telamone natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47649.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlămōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">son of Telamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Telamonian</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Ajax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:525" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 737</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47649.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlămō-nĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the offspring of Telamon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ajax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telanaeficus: <entryFree id="n47650" type="main" key="tela_nae fi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">telānae fīcus</orth>, <sense id="n47650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of black fig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telandria: <entryFree id="n47651" type="main" key="Telandria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Telandria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telchines: <entryFree id="n47652" type="main" key="Telchi_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Telchīnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*telxi=nes,</foreign> <sense id="n47652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabled family of priests in Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for their magic arts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:274" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 274</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teleboae: <entryFree id="n47653" type="main" key="Te_le^bo^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕbŏae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*thlebo/ai,</foreign> <sense id="n47653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Acarnania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted for robbing travellers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 95 al.</bibl> A colony of them afterwards inhabited the island of Capreae: <cit><quote lang="la">Teleboūm Capreas regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 735</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:418" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 418</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕbŏis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Teleboæ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Teleboic.—Plur</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕbŏĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of some small islands between Leucadia and Achaia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teleboas: <entryFree id="n47654" type="main" key="Te_le^bo^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕbŏas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centaur killed by Nestor at the marriage of Pirithous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 441</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telegonus: <entryFree id="n47655" type="main" key="Te_le^go^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕgŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*thle/gonos,</foreign> <sense id="n47655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Ulysses and Circe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when he came to Ithaca</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed his father without knowing him; on his return he founded Tusculum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 127" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl> (3, 30), 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:92" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:692" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 692</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:535" default="NO">12, 535</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 127" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 127</bibl>.—As an appellative: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕgŏni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the amatory poems of Ovid</hi>, so called because his misfortunes arose from them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:114" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telemachus: <entryFree id="n47656" type="main" key="Te_le^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*thle/maxos,</foreign> <sense id="n47656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Ulysses and Penelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 127" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telemus: <entryFree id="n47657" type="main" key="Te_le^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*th/lemos,</foreign> <sense id="n47657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 770</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 128" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telendos: <entryFree id="n47658" type="main" key="Telendos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Telendos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telephion: <entryFree id="n47659" type="greek" key="te_le^phi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēlĕphĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">thle/fion,</foreign> <sense id="n47659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of herb resembling purslane</hi>: Sedum telephium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 110, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telephus: <entryFree id="n47660" type="main" key="Te_le^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēlĕphus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*th/lefos.</foreign> <sense id="n47660.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hercules and the nymph Auge.</hi> He was wounded before Troy by the spear of Achilles, but was afterwards oured by its rust, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 101" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 45, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:42" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 19, § 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47660.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contemporary and friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telesia: <entryFree id="n47661" type="main" key="Te^le^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlĕsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the village Telese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telestes: <entryFree id="n47662" type="main" key="Te^lestes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlestes</orth>, <itype>is or ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Ianthe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 716</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telestus: <entryFree id="n47663" type="main" key="Te^lestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teleta: <entryFree id="n47664" type="greek" key="te^le^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teleth/,</foreign> <sense id="n47664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">initiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268 sq.</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 9; 10, 23; 4, 31.</sense></entryFree>
telethrius: <entryFree id="n47665" type="main" key="Te^lethrius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlethrius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grassy mountain of Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telethusa: <entryFree id="n47666" type="main" key="Te^le^thu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕlĕthūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Ligdus and mother of Iphis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:682 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 682 sq.</bibl> <pb n="1847" /> <cb n="TELM" /></sense></entryFree>
teletus: <entryFree id="n47667" type="greek" key="te^le^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teleto/s</foreign> (perfect), <sense id="n47667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æons</hi>, Tert. adv Val. 8.</sense></entryFree>
telicardios: <entryFree id="n47668" type="greek" key="telicardi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">telicardĭos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">thelycardĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> muchula, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teliger: <entryFree id="n47669" type="hapax" key="te_li^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēlĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>telumgero</etym>, <sense id="n47669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dart - bearing</hi>, an epithet of Cupid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 543" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 543</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telinum: <entryFree id="n47670" type="greek" key="te_li^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">th/linon,</foreign> <sense id="n47670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a costly ointment prepared from the herb</hi> telis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
telirrhizos: <entryFree id="n47671" type="greek" key="telirrhizos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">telirrhizos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">thelyrrhizos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telis: <entryFree id="n47672" type="greek" key="te_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">th=lis,</foreign> <sense id="n47672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb fenugreek</hi> Trigonella foenum Graecum, Linn.: <cit><quote lang="la">foenum Graecum quod telin vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 120, § 184</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tellena: <entryFree id="n47673" type="main" key="Telle_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tellēna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Toretta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tel-lēnē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl> (Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
tellumo: <entryFree id="n47674" type="main" key="Tellu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tellūmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a god among the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the personified productive power of the earth</hi>, answering to Tellus as a goddess, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tellūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tellus: <entryFree id="n47675" type="main" key="tellu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tellūs</orth> (-ŭs short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 584</bibl>), <itype>ūris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root tollo, to bear</etym>, <sense id="n47675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, opp. to the other planets or to the sea, <hi rend="ital">the globe</hi> (a word belonging almost entirely to poetry). </sense><sense id="n47675.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47675.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae est media et nona, tellus, neque movetur et infima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in medio mundo sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D. 2, 39, 98 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. terra): animae vis aut extrinsecus aut ipsā tellure coörta, Lucr 6, 579: telluris operta subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 140</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47675.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi> (cf. solum): quāque fuit tellus, illic et pontus et aër; <cit><quote lang="la">Sic erat instabilis tellus, innabilis unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: jamque mare et tellus nullum discrimen habebant; <cit><quote lang="la">Omnia pontus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullis Saucia vomeribus per se dabat omnia tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercetque frequens tellurem atque imperat arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddit ubi Cererem tellus inarata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non presso tellus exsurgit aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:161" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis sine arbore tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundit humo facilem victum justissima tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 460</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47675.4" n="C" level="2"> Personified, Tellus, <hi rend="ital">Earth</hi>, as a productive, nourishing divinity: unam eandemque terram habere geminam vim, et masculinam, quod semina producat et femininam, quod recipiat atque enutriat. Inde a vi femininā dictam esse Tellurem, a masculinā Tellumonem, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum (invocabo), qui omnes fructus agriculturae caelo et terrā continent, Jovem et Tellurem: itaque quod ii parentes magni dicuntur, Juppiter pater appellatur, Tellus, terra mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; and; <cit><quote lang="la">si est Ceres a gerendo, terra ipsa dea est: quae enim est alia Tellus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tellurem porco, Silvanum lacte piabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis Telluris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Telluris (sc. aede),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tellus mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47675.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territory</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: regio, terra): Tuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:57" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus barbara Scythiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 91</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">barbara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:515" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gnosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assaraci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
telluster: <entryFree id="n47676" type="hapax" key="telluster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">telluster</orth>, <itype>tris, e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tellus</etym>, <sense id="n47676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrestrial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellustres silvicolaeque divi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 729</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
telmessus: <entryFree id="n47677" type="main" key="Telmessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmessus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Telmissus</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tel-mēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*telmhssos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*telmisso/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near to Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the head of the Glaucus Sinus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Makri;</hi> it was famed for the skill of its inhabitants in divination, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47677.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmessĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Telmissĭcus, -mē-sicus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Telmessus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Telmessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telmissicus sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit> Telmessicum vinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47677.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmissĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Telmissus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Telmissian.</hi> Ptolemaeus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 4</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmissĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the innabitants of Telmissus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Telmissians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castra Telmissium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56</bibl></cit> Drak. <cb n="TELU" /> <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (s. l. v.).—</sense><sense id="n47677.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmesses</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-me-ses</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 42, 94</bibl>; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tel-messenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Telmessus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Telmessians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47677.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Telmessis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Telmessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 248</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
telonarius: <entryFree id="n47678" type="main" key="te^lo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>telonium</etym>, <sense id="n47678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tollgatherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collector of the customs</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 28, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
telonium: <entryFree id="n47679" type="main" key="te^lo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕlōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nĕum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">telw/nion,</foreign> <sense id="n47679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a toll-booth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bapt. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 5, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
telum: <entryFree id="n47680" type="main" key="te_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for texlum; root <foreign lang="greek">tek-,</foreign> of <foreign lang="greek">ti/ktw,</foreign> to beget; <foreign lang="greek">tuk-, tux-,</foreign> of <foreign lang="greek">tugxa/nw,</foreign> to hit, chance upon; v. texo; cf. <foreign lang="greek">to/con,</foreign> a bow</etym>, <sense id="n47680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weapon used for fighting at a distance; a missile weapon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">missile</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">a dart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>, etc. (while arma signifies arms for defence or close fight; v. arma; cf.: jaculum, tormentum). </sense><sense id="n47680.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tela proprie dici videntur ea, quae missilia sunt: ex Graeco videlicet translato eorum nomine, quoniam illi <foreign lang="greek">thlo/qen</foreign> missa dicunt, quae nos eminus; <cit><quote lang="la">sicut arma ea, quae ab umeris dependentia retinentur manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 3</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 509</bibl>: telum vulgo quidem id appellatur, quod ab arcu mittitur, sed nunc omne significatur, quod mittitur manu. Itaque sequitur, ut et lapis et lignum et ferrum hoc nomine contineatur, dictum ab eo, quod in longinquum mittitur, Graecā voce figuratum <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ tou= thlou=,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:233" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 233</bibl>: arma rigent, horrescunt tela, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 177 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:38" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 201</bibl>: tela manu jacere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 438 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis jaciat volatile telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:970" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 970</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela depellere...telum jacere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47</bibl>; 2, 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 52 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes levium telorum conjecta obruit aciem Gallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 26, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: it toto turbida caelo Tempestas telorum ac ferreus ingruit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum ex loco superiore mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani omni genere missilium telorum ac saxis maxime vulnerabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 449, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ad conjectum teli veniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis repulsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non primus Teucer tela Cydonio Direxit arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medios telum torsisti primus Achivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërias telum contendit in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum volatile sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:524" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic confixum ferrea texit Telorum seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 776</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47680.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47680.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an offensive weapon</hi> of any kind, as <hi rend="ital">a sword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poniard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">axe</hi>, etc. (class.): Ajax gladio incubuit; <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes intervenit ... e corpore cruentum telum educit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus (telis) ille maximum sicarum numerum et gladiorum extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatam securim in caput dejecit: relictoque in vulnere telo ambo se foras eiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tuba terruerit, non strictis agmina telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela aliis hastae, aliis secures erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavae tela erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare in comitio cum telo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. freq.: esse cum telo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 2 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse cum telo hominis occidendi causā (lex) vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui caedem telo quocumque commiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pereat positum rubigine telum,</quote> <trans><tr>my sheathed sword</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars caret altera telo Frontis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a horn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:883" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 883</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the caestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:772" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 772</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47680.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">be/los</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott, sub voce), </sense><sense id="n47680.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A sunbeam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non radii solis neque lucida tela diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 92</bibl>; 6, 40.—</sense><sense id="n47680.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium est in sua tela Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:316" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere irato tela trisulca Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 5, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47680.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stitch in the side</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 22, 402</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47680.8" n="4" level="3"> = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:78:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 78, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47680.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weapon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dart</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 113</bibl>: usque quāque sapere oportet: id erit telum acerrimum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl>; cf.: nec mediocre telum ad <cb n="TEME" /> res gerendas existimare oportet benevolen, tiam civium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gelidis torpet telis perfixa pavoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris telis accipere ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1052" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1052</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas, quae ultimum ac maximum telum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā lege tribunitiis rogationibus telum acerrimum datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de corpore rei publicae tuorum scelerum tela revellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubrationis telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis tribunicia, telum a majoribus libertati paratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. Macri Licinii ad Pleb. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. Macri Licinii ad Pleb. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire et linguae tela subire tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temarunda: <entryFree id="n47681" type="main" key="Temarunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Temarunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian name of the Palus Mæotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temenitis: <entryFree id="n47682" type="main" key="Te^me^ni_tis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Temenos.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47683" type="main" key="Te^me^ni_tis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni=tis</foreign> (Polyb. c. 27, 7): <sense id="n47683.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>a gate of Tarentum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9, 9</bibl></cit> (v Weissenb. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
temenos: <entryFree id="n47684" type="main" key="Te^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">te/menos, to/,</foreign> <sense id="n47684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place at Syracuse sacred to Apollo;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n47684.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni/ths,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apollo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47684.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni=tis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a fountain at Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temerarie: <entryFree id="n47685" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temerarius <sense id="n47685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temerarius: <entryFree id="n47686" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>temere</etym>. <sense id="n47686.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That happens by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casual</hi> (so very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fortuitus): sed quid hoc, quod picus ulmum tundit? hau temerarium'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temerarium est, ubi dives blande appellat pauperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: quaestus temerarius incertusque, Fest. s. v. navalis scriba, p. 169 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">tributum temerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 364</bibl></cit>, b, ib.; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 129 sq. — </sense><sense id="n47686.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadvised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audacious</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: audax, audens): temulenta mulier et temeraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines temerarii atque imperiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem esse barbarum, iracundum, temerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca ac temeraria dominatrix animi cupiditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum tam temerarius nec audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:43:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce meo, juvenis, temerarius esse periclo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 545</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: ea sunt et turbulenta et temeraria et periculosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus animi temerariis partibus conpressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: consilium, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">vox, Liv 23, 22, 9: virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sent thoughtlessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:616" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium est, ante crassitudinem pollicarem viti imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium est, secundis non esse contentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temeratio: <entryFree id="n47687" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>temero</etym>, <sense id="n47687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forging</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 32, 1.</sense></entryFree>
temerator: <entryFree id="n47688" type="main" key="te^me^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravisher</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 600</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 53, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47688.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temere: <entryFree id="n47689" type="main" key="te^me^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrē</orth> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ-mĕrĭter</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> p.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 5</bibl>; Trag.
