<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sero post tempus venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47738.19" n="E" level="2"> Ex tempore, <hi rend="ital">instantaneously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the spur of the moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extempore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus fundere ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum optimorum versuum dicere ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl>, praef.—</sense><sense id="n47738.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">According to circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedire rem et consilium ex tempore capere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec melius ex re et ex tempore constitues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47738.21" n="F" level="1"> In tempore, <hi rend="ital">at the right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">appropriate time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tempore ad eam veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso tempore eccum ipsum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the nick of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni pedites equitesque in tempore subvenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tempore memorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47738.22" n="G" level="1"> In tempus, <hi rend="ital">for a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scena in tempus structa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omne tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>forever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47738.23" n="H" level="1"> Per tempus, <hi rend="ital">at the right time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potuisti magis per tempus mihi advenire quam advenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per tempus subvenistis mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47738.24" n="K" level="1"> Pro tempore, <hi rend="ital">according to circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium pro tempore et pro re capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca pro tempore milites hortatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tempyra: <entryFree id="n47739" type="main" key="Tempy_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempȳra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town</hi> (<hi rend="ital">harbor</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in the south of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ægæan Sea</hi>, Liv 38, 41, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temulenter: <entryFree id="n47740" type="main" key="te_mu^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmŭlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>temulentus</etym>, <sense id="n47740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a drunken person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunkenly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eructare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temulentia: <entryFree id="n47741" type="main" key="te_mu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drunkenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inebriation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxication</hi> (post - Aug. and very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: vinolentia, ebrietas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 2, 4, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 22, 28</bibl>, §§ 140 and 148; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temulentus: <entryFree id="n47742" type="main" key="te_mu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [root tem, whence temetum; formed in analogy with vinolentus. <sense id="n47742.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intoxicated</hi> (syn.: ebrius, vinosus): agite, exite, temulentum tollite, Nov. ap. Fest. s. v. temetum, p. 364 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Afran. ib.: mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatem impendentem tueri temulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam (Indiam) temulento agmine comisabundus incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 28, 2</bibl>: ipsum offendunt temulento sopore profligatum, M. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Vitellium omnia indisposita, temulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temulentae reliquiae sumptuosissimae cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25, 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putidior, temulentior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmŭlenti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47742.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries ambrosiā temulenta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dripping</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenacia: <entryFree id="n47743" type="hapax" key="te^na_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tenax, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n47743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stubbornness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>: equorum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 407, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 220 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
tenacitas: <entryFree id="n47744" type="main" key="te^na_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tenax</etym>, <sense id="n47744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacity</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n47744.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(animalia) cibum partim unguium tenacitate arripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47744.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a holding fast to money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parsimony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenaciter: <entryFree id="n47745" type="main" key="te^na_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tenax <sense id="n47745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tenaculum: <entryFree id="n47746" type="hapax" key="te^na_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>, <sense id="n47746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for holding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a holder</hi>, Ter. Maur. praef. 29, p 2383 P.</sense></entryFree>
tenax: <entryFree id="n47747" type="main" key="te^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">griping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47747.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47747.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">prensatque tenaci forcipe ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 453</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dente tenaci Ancora fundabat naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:377" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lappa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hedera arborem implicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca limosa tenacia gravi caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maltha, quae est res omnium tenacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 58, § 181</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba asperitate etiam vestium tenaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis tenacior capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnāces</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things that hold fast.</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">bands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stalks</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pedicles</hi> of fruit, <cb n="TEND" /> etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 4</bibl> and 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">holding fast</hi> to wealth, power, etc., <hi rend="ital">griping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stingy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacious</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. parcus): filius familias patre parco ac tenaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Tenaxne pater ejus est? <hi rend="ital">Phi.</hi> Immo edepol pertinax, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcus, truculentus, tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem restrictos et tenaces fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tenax in largitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Car. 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Quaesiti tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 657</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites tenaciores eorum (armorum) in proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">that holds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sticks fast</hi>: jacere in tenaci gramine, <hi rend="ital">that clings together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">matted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebis tenacissimum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae,</quote> <trans><tr>sticky</tr>, <tr>viscid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe referre pedem nec passu stare tenaci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondere tenacior navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panicula glutino tenacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47747.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Holding fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persistent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenacious</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); usually joined with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria tenacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā tenacissimi sumus eorum, quae rudibus annis percepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinacem ultra modum esse tenacem propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 405</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenacem esse sui juris debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae tenacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 85</bibl></cit> (17): <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficti pravique (Fama),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:48" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempli sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 84, 3</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa tenaxque fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.8" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">stubborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus contra sua vincla tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a lusus verbb.: si esses equos, esses indomabilis ... nimis tenax es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum video, quam sint mea fata tenacia, frangor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenaciously.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47747.9" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressisse tenaciter ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47747.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">persistently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenchtheri: <entryFree id="n47748" type="main" key="Tenchthe_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tenchthēri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tenctēri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people on the Rhine</hi>, in the neighborhood of the modern <hi rend="ital">Cleves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Essen</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">Bergen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tendeba: <entryFree id="n47749" type="main" key="Tende_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tendēba</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/ndhba,</foreign> <sense id="n47749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tendicula: <entryFree id="n47750" type="main" key="tendi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tendĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tendo</etym>, <sense id="n47750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stretcher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47750.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta tendiculis diducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47750.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> ( = fraus), <hi rend="ital">a little snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aucupia verborum et litterarum tendiculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: verborum tendiculas aucupemur, Ambros. de Fide, 3, 5, § 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tendo: <entryFree id="n47751" type="main" key="tendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tendo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tenno</orth>), <itype>tĕtendi, tentum and tensum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root ten-, tan, v. teneo; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/nw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n47751.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, etc. (class.; cf.: extendo, explico). </sense><sense id="n47751.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47751.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">suntne igitur insidiae, tendere plagas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. nequitum, p. 162 Müll.: quia non rete accipitri tennitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 16 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">retia (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 513</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 701</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 331 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casses alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intumescit collum, nervi tenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chordam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 604</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:51" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 51</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas Arcu,</quote> <trans><tr>to shoot</tr>, <tr>hurl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariterque oculos telumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbiton,</quote> <trans><tr>to tune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana tenta tonant palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validā lora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela (Noti),</quote> <trans><tr>to swell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipiti carbasa tenta Noto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorium,</quote> <trans><tr>to stretch out</tr>, <tr>pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: pelles in ordine tentae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conopia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 45: grabatos restibus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: manus ad caeli caerula templa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 51 Vahl.); so, manus ad caelum, <cb n="TEND" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia ad caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 279</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 293</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: bracchia caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:580" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 580</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 210: ad legatos atque exercitum supplices manus tendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manus ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sidera palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super aequora palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem orantia bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 9, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus supplices dis immortalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis supplex manus tendit patria communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 723</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus supinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ripae ulterioris amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 314</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Graecia tendit dexteram Italiae,</quote> <trans><tr>stretches forth</tr>, <tr>reaches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(conjux) parvum patri tendebat Iulum,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu munera supplex Tende, petens pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tendant ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>aim</tr>, <tr>direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua nunc se ponti plaga caerula tendit,</quote> <trans><tr>stretches itself out</tr>, <tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 481</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47751.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">nervum tendere, in mal. part.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 60, 3</bibl>.—Hence, tentus, <hi rend="ital">a lecherous man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:73:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 73, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34 al.</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47751.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: insidiae tenduntur alicui, <hi rend="ital">are spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laid</hi> (qs. like nets), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes insidias animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum vigilem,</quote> <trans><tr>to strain</tr>, <tr>exert</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: longo tendit praecordia voto, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Ol. 66; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus in Satirā videor nimis acer et ultra Legem tendere opus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to heighten</tr>, <tr>aggravate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestivam sermone benigno noctem,</quote> <trans><tr>to protract</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lunam) Tanto posse minus cum Signis tendere cursum,</quote> <trans><tr>to direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum ex acie in Capitolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:216" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum ad agmina suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ad naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter pennis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dominum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum unde et quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter in Hispaniam, Auct. B. Afr. 95: cunctis civibus lucem ingenii et consilii sui porrigens atque tendens,</quote> <trans><tr>tendering</tr>, <tr>offering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47751.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47751.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To direct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s course; to aim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s course</hi> in any direction (class.). </sense><sense id="n47751.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubito an Venusiam tendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Beneventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursuque amens ad limina tendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad domum Bruti et Cassii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciconum ad oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad metam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:453" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 453</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter ad alterum tenderemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde venis? et Quo tendis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tendere pergunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendimus huc (sc. in Orcum) omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 34</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n47751.8" n="b" level="4"> Of things concrete or abstract, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem locum quaeque (imago) tendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levibus in sublime tendentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursum tendit palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra viis derectis omnia tendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 609</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case> of direction: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc aethera tendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera (via), quae Ditis magni sub moenia tendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula tendit ad stomachum, is ad ventrem,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches</tr>, <tr>extends</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus mons ad occasum tendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Portae Caspiae, quae per Iberiam in Sarmatas tendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu mollis quā tendit Ionia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47751.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47751.10" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to aim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be directed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tend</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">ad reliqua alacri tendebamus animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad altiora et non concessa tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO">12, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Carthaginienses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii alio tenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum sententiae tendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: tenes, quorsum haec tendant, quae loquor, <hi rend="ital">tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, = spectent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 21</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47751.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Laocoon) manibus tendit divellere nodos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pasta (nitedula) rursus Ire foras pleno tendebat corpore frustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: captae <pb n="1853" /> <cb n="TENE" /> civitati leges imponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod efficere tendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratresque tendentes opaco Pelion imposuisse Olympo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendit disertus haberi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua tendit rumpere plumbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:139" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 154</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles tendere, inde ad jurgium,</quote> <trans><tr>insists</tr>, <tr>persists</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47751.12" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to exert one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self in opposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi> (class. but not freq. till the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec nos obniti contra nec tendere tantum Sufficimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: nec mora nec requies; <cit><quote lang="la">vasto certamine tendunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petreius ubi videt Catilinam contra ac ratus erat magnā vi tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summā vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 32, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 51, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius contra, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tendit? cum efficere non possit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>what does he strive for? to what do his efforts tend?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illi tendere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 377</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47751.13" n="B" level="2"> For tentoria tendere, <hi rend="ital">to set up tents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be under tents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be encamped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sub vallo tenderent mercatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus extra vallum jussis tendere, Frontin. Strat. 4, 1, 18: vallo tendetis in illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Dolopum manus, hic saevus tendebat Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio latis tendebat in arvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isdem castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">isdem hibernis tendentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lugduni tendentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multitudo laxius tenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:6" default="NO">5, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:37" default="NO">7, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendere in campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 20</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawn tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tense</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rectissima linea tensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remissis magis quam tensis (digitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox tensior (opp. remissior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormento citharāque tensior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 6</bibl></cit> and 70.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
tendor: <entryFree id="n47752" type="hapax" key="tendor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tendor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tendo</etym>, <sense id="n47752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenea: <entryFree id="n47753" type="main" key="Tene^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tenĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tene/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town between Corinth and Mycenæ</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Klenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebellae: <entryFree id="n47754" type="hapax" key="te^ne^bellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕbellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tenebrae</etym>, <sense id="n47754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tenebrae: <entryFree id="n47755" type="main" key="te^ne_^brae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^-bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 25</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to Sanscr. tamisra, dark; cf. timere</etym>, <sense id="n47755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi> (stronger than obscuritas, and weaker than caligo; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n47755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47755.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti pueri omnia caecis In tenebris metuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas atque tenebrae Coperiunt maria ac terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum obscurato sole tenebrae factae essent repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos tenebras cogitemus tantas, quantae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetrae tenebrae et caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. caligo: tenebras et solitudinem nacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incultu, tenebris, odore foeda atque terribilis ejus (Tulliani) facies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis noctis tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtentā densantur nocte tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve velit (Sol) tenebras inducere rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 114</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47755.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47755.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The darkness of night</hi>, <hi rend="ital">night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire luce, non tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem in statione usque ad noctem tenuit: primis tenebris movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus qui faciat breves tenebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 47, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris,</quote> <trans><tr>during the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:76" default="NO">2, 1, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris obortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tenebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(me) videt pulsis Aurora tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effulget tenebris Aurora fugatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47755.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The darkness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dimness of a swoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swoon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae oboriuntur, genua inedia succidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 824</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 735</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 41</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47755.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The darkness of death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death-shades</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">juro, Me tibi ad extremas mansuram tenebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 17; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(urbes) ad Erebi profundos hiatus abactae, aeternis tenebris occultantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. also in a play upon this signif. and that of B. 1.: certum'st mihi ante tenebras <cb n="TENE" /> (i. e. noctem) tenebras (i. e. mortem) persequi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47755.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Blindness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">occidit extemplo lumen tenebraeque sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras et cladem lucis ademptae Obicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 515</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:407" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 407</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47755.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47755.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dark bathing-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Grylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:60:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 60, 3</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n47755.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A prison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dungeon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausi in tenebris, cum maerore et luctu morte graviorem vitam exigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: in atras et profundas tenebras eum claudebant, Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47755.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lurking-places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haunts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emersus ex diuturnis tenebris lustrorum ac stuprorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstres, ubi sint tuae tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47755.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poor lodgings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti nunc tenebras unum conducis in annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 225</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47755.13" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae malae Orci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Styga, quid tenebras timetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47755.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi> of the mind, of fame, of fortune, fate, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">isti tantis offusis tenebris ne scintillam quidem ullam nobis ad dispiciendum reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obducere tenebras rebus clarissimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus fulgore quodam suae claritatis tenebras obduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: quas tu mihi tenebras cudis? <hi rend="ital">what darkness are you raising about me?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">what trick are you playing me?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras dispulit calumniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae jacerent omnia in tenebris, nisi litterarum lumen accederet,</quote> <trans><tr>obscurity</tr>, <tr>concealment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestram familiam abjectam et obscuram e tenebris in lucem evocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: o tenebrae, o lutum, o sordes (Piso)! <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">low birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl>: vitae, <hi rend="ital">gloomy fate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortunes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi aestus, qui error, qui tenebrae erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis rei publicae tenebris caecisque nubibus et procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superioris anni caligine et tenebris lucem in re publicā dispicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tenebrarum offudit exilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si offusa rei publicae sempiterna nox esset, ita ruebant in tenebris omniaque miscebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebrarius: <entryFree id="n47756" type="hapax" key="te^ne_^bra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenebrae</etym>, <sense id="n47756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to darkness</hi>: homo, <hi rend="ital">a fellow that shuns the light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giddy fellow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">an obscure person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 2</bibl> (al. tenebrarum).</sense></entryFree>
tenebratio: <entryFree id="n47757" type="main" key="te^ne_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tenebro</etym>, <sense id="n47757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darkening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscuration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit> and 4, 66.</sense></entryFree>
tenebresco: <entryFree id="n47758" type="main" key="te^ne_^bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^bresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brasco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [tenebrae], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become dark</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. ad Lit. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. ad Lit. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 11, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebrico: <entryFree id="n47759" type="hapax" key="te^ne_^bri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tenebricus</etym>, <sense id="n47759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become dark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol mediā die tenebricavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> ex Amos, 8, 9 (where the Vulg. has tenebrescit).</sense></entryFree>
tenebricositas: <entryFree id="n47760" type="hapax" key="te^ne_^bri^co_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brĭcōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tenebricosus</etym>, <sense id="n47760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dimness of the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl>, n. 73.</sense></entryFree>
tenebricosus: <entryFree id="n47761" type="main" key="te^ne_^bri^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenebricus</etym>, <sense id="n47761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of darkness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gloom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrouded in darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">esse sensus non obscuros sed tenebricosos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebricosissimum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus angustus et tenebricosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebricus: <entryFree id="n47762" type="main" key="te^ne_^bri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenebrae</etym>, <sense id="n47762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (very rare): nam te in tenebricā saepe lacerabo fame Clausum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 14</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 158 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tartarea tenebrica plaga, * Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>dark</tr>, <tr>black</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tenebrio: <entryFree id="n47763" type="main" key="te^ne_^bri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who shuns the light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trickster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swindler</hi> (ante-class.): tenebrio Tyrius, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 4</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 109 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 6</bibl> and 13.</sense></entryFree>
tenebro: <entryFree id="n47764" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vesperā semitam tenebrante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebrose: <entryFree id="n47765" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tenebrosus <sense id="n47765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tenebrosus: <entryFree id="n47766" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenebrae</etym>, <cb n="TENE" /> <sense id="n47766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n47766.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra dimovit tenebrosum et dispu lit umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 839</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:359" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus tenebroso caecus hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnea Grylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 60, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 13</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleo tenebrosa situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:400" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 329</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. — Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 4, 12</bibl>; and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenebrosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47766.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrosissimus error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 43, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ-nē^brōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">darkly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ion. 4, 6</bibl> (with occulte).</sense></entryFree>
tenedos: <entryFree id="n47767" type="main" key="Te^ne^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕdos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/nedos,</foreign> <sense id="n47767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off the coast of Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after king</hi> Tenes or Tennes (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*te/nnhs</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">who received divine honors;</hi> still called <hi rend="ital">Tenedos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 21 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">the name of the capital of this island</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 109</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕ-dĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tenedos</hi>: Tenediā securi, <hi rend="ital">according to the strict justice of king Tenes</hi>, prov., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 2</bibl>; M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 9</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕdii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tenedos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenellulus: <entryFree id="n47768" type="main" key="te^nellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnellŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tenellus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat tender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (perh. only in the two following passages): <cit><quote lang="la">puella tenellulo delicatior haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 15</bibl></cit>: manu lascivulā et tenellulā, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tenellus: <entryFree id="n47769" type="main" key="te^nellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tener], <hi rend="ital">somewhat tender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bella et tenella Casina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: vates, Domit. Mart. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae pullorum equinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenellum enim cito facit putre (aqua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
teneo: <entryFree id="n47770" type="main" key="te^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĕnŭi, tentum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n47770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> tetinerim, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetinerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 178:12" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 178, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetinisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 178:11" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 178, 11</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> tetinero, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll. Another collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> tenivi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 220</bibl> P.; Diom. pp. 363 and 369 ib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root ten-, tan-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta/numai, tei/nw;</foreign> Sanscr. tanomi, to stretch, spread; this root appears in many derived meanings; cf.
